verses.verse: And when Rachel<WH7354> saw<WH7200> that she bare<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> no children<WH7354>, Rachel envied<WH7065> her sister<WH269>; and she said<WH559> unto Jacob<WH3290>, Give<WH3051> me children<WH1121>, or else<WH369> I die<WH4191>.
And Jacob<WH3290>'s anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against Rachel<WH7354>: and he said<WH559>, Am I in God<WH430>'s stead<WH4513>, who hath withheld from thee the fruit<WH6529> of the womb<WH990>?
And she said<WH559>, Behold<WH519>, my maid Bilhah<WH1090>, go in<WH935> unto her<WH3205>; that she may bear upon my knees<WH1290>, and I also may obtain children by her<WH1129>.
And she gave<WH5414> him Bilhah<WH1090> her handmaid<WH8198> to wife<WH802>: and Jacob<WH3290> went in unto her<WH935>.
And Bilhah<WH1090> conceived<WH2029>, and bare<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> a son<WH1121>.

And Rachel<WH7354> said<WH559>, God<WH430> hath judged<WH1777> me<WH8085>, and hath also heard my voice<WH6963>, and hath given<WH5414> me a son<WH1121>: therefore called<WH7121> she his name<WH8034> Dan<WH1835>.
And Bilhah<WH1090> Rachel<WH7354>'s handmaid<WH8198> conceived<WH2029> again<WH3205>, and bare Jacob<WH3290> a second<WH8145> son<WH1121>.

And Rachel<WH7354> said<WH559>, With mighty<WH430> wrestlings<WH5319> have I wrestled<WH6617> with my sister<WH269>, and have prevailed<WH3201>: and she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Naphtali<WH5321>.
When Leah<WH3812> saw<WH7200> that she had left<WH5975> off bearing<WH3205>, she took<WH3947> Zilpah<WH2153> her handmaid<WH8198>, and gave<WH5414> her to Jacob<WH3290> to wife<WH802>.
And Zilpah<WH2153> Leah<WH3812>'s handmaid<WH8198> bare<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> a son<WH1121>.
And Leah<WH3812> said<WH559>, Fortunate<WH1409>! and<WH935> she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Gad<WH1410>.
And Zilpah<WH2153> Leah<WH3812>'s handmaid<WH8198> bare<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> a second<WH8145> son<WH1121>.
And Leah<WH3812> said<WH559>, Happy am I<WH837>! for the daughters<WH1323> will call me happy<WH833>: and she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Asher<WH836>.

And Reuben<WH7205> went in<WH3212> the days<WH3117> of wheat<WH2406> harvest<WH7105>, and found<WH4672> mandrakes<WH1736> in the field<WH7704>, and brought<WH935> them unto his mother<WH517> Leah<WH3812>. Then Rachel<WH7354> said<WH559> to Leah<WH3812>, Give me<WH5414>, I pray thee<WH1121>, of thy son's mandrakes<WH1736>.

And she said<WH559> unto her<WH4592>, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken<WH3947> away<WH3947> my husband<WH376>? and wouldest thou take away<WH3947> my son<WH1121>'s mandrakes<WH1736> also<WH7354>? And Rachel said<WH559>, Therefore he shall lie<WH7901> with thee to-night<WH8478> for thy son<WH1121>'s mandrakes<WH1736>.

And Jacob<WH3290> came<WH935> from the field<WH7704> in the evening<WH6153>, and Leah<WH3812> went out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> him<WH559>, and said, Thou must come in<WH935> unto me<WH7936>; for I have surely hired<WH7936> thee with my son<WH1121>'s mandrakes<WH1736>. And he lay<WH7901> with her that night<WH3915>.
And God<WH430> hearkened<WH8085> unto Leah<WH3812>, and she conceived<WH2029>, and bare<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> a fifth<WH2549> son<WH1121>.

And Leah<WH3812> said<WH559>, God<WH430> hath given<WH5414> me my hire<WH7939>, because<WH834> I gave<WH5414> my handmaid<WH8198> to my husband<WH376>: and she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Issachar<WH3485>.
And Leah<WH3812> conceived<WH2029> again<WH3205>, and bare a sixth<WH8345> son<WH1121> to Jacob<WH3290>.

And Leah<WH3812> said<WH559>, God<WH430> hath endowed<WH2064> me with a good<WH2896> dowry<WH2065>; now<WH6471> will my husband<WH376> dwell<WH2082> with me<WH3205>, because I have borne him six<WH8337> sons<WH1121>: and she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Zebulun<WH2074>.
And afterwards<WH310> she bare<WH3205> a daughter<WH1323>, and called<WH7121> her name<WH8034> Dinah<WH1783>.
And God<WH430> remembered<WH2142> Rachel<WH7354>, and God<WH430> hearkened<WH8085> to her<WH6605>, and opened her womb<WH7358>.
And she conceived<WH2029>, and bare<WH3205> a son<WH1121>: and said<WH559>, God<WH430> hath taken away<WH622> my reproach<WH2781>:
and she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Joseph<WH3130>, saying<WH559>, Jehovah<WH3068> add<WH3254> to me another<WH312> son<WH1121>.

And it came to pass<WH7354>, when Rachel had borne<WH3205> Joseph<WH3130>, that Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> unto Laban<WH3837>, Send me away<WH7971>, that I may go<WH3212> unto mine own place<WH4725>, and to my country<WH776>.

Give <WH5414> me my wives<WH802> and my children<WH3206> for<WH2004> whom I have served<WH5647> thee<WH3212>, and let me go: for thou knowest<WH3045> my service<WH5656> wherewith I have served thee<WH5647>.

And Laban<WH3837> said<WH559> unto him<WH4672>, If now I have found favor<WH2580> in thine eyes<WH5869>, tarry<WH5172>: for I have divined that Jehovah<WH3068> hath blessed<WH1288> me for thy sake<WH1558>.
And he said<WH559>, Appoint<WH5344> me thy wages<WH7939>, and I will give it<WH5414>.
And he said<WH559> unto him<WH3045>, Thou knowest how<WH834> I have served<WH5647> thee<WH834>, and how thy cattle have fared with me<WH4735>.

For it was little<WH4592> which thou hadst before I<WH6440> came<WH6555>, and it hath increased unto a multitude<WH7230>; and Jehovah<WH3068> hath blessed<WH1288> thee whithersoever I turned<WH7272>: and now when<WH4970> shall I provide<WH6213> for mine own house also<WH1004>?

And he said<WH559>, What shall I give thee<WH5414>? And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559>, Thou shalt not give<WH5414> me aught<WH3972>: if thou wilt do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> for me<WH7725>, I will again feed<WH7462> thy flock<WH6629> and keep it<WH8104>.

I will pass<WH5674> through all thy flock<WH6629> to-day<WH3117>, removing<WH5493> from thence every speckled<WH5348> and spotted<WH2921> one<WH7716>, and every black<WH2345> one<WH7716> among the sheep<WH3775>, and the spotted<WH2921> and speckled<WH5348> among the goats<WH5795>: and of such shall be my hire<WH7939>.

So shall my righteousness<WH6666> answer<WH6030> for me hereafter<WH3117>, when<WH4279> thou shalt come<WH935> concerning my hire<WH7939> that is before thee<WH6440>: every one<WH3605> that is not speckled<WH5348> and spotted<WH2921> among the goats<WH5795>, and black<WH2345> among the sheep<WH3775>, that<WH1589>, if found with me, shall be counted stolen.
And Laban<WH3837> said<WH559>, Behold<WH3863>, I would it might be according to thy word<WH1697>.

And he removed<WH5493> that day<WH3117> the he-goats<WH8495> that were ringstreaked<WH6124> and spotted<WH2921>, and all the she-goats<WH5795> that were speckled<WH5348> and spotted<WH2921>, every one that had white<WH3836> in it<WH2345>, and all the black ones among the sheep<WH3775>, and gave<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of his sons<WH1121>;
and he set<WH7760> three<WH7969> days<WH3117>' journey<WH1870> betwixt himself and Jacob<WH3290>: and Jacob<WH3290> fed<WH7462> the rest<WH3498> of Laban<WH3837>'s flocks<WH6629>.

And Jacob<WH3290> took<WH3947> him rods<WH4731> of fresh<WH3892> poplar<WH3839>, and of the almond<WH3869> and of the plane-tree<WH6196>; and peeled<WH6478> white<WH3836> streaks<WH6479> in them<WH3836>, and made the white appear<WH4286> which was in the rods<WH4731>.

And he set<WH3322> the rods<WH4731> which he had peeled<WH6478> over<WH5227> against the flocks<WH6629> in the gutters<WH7298> in the watering-troughs<WH4325> where<WH8268> the flocks<WH6629> came<WH935> to drink<WH8354>; and they conceived<WH3179> when they came<WH935> to drink<WH8354>.
And the flocks<WH6629> conceived<WH3179> before the rods<WH4731>, and the flocks<WH6629> brought forth<WH3205> ringstreaked<WH6124>, speckled<WH5348>, and spotted<WH2921>.

And Jacob<WH3290> separated<WH6504> the lambs<WH3775>, and set<WH5414> the faces<WH6440> of the flocks<WH6629> toward<WH413> the ringstreaked<WH6124> and all the black<WH2345> in the flock<WH6629> of Laban<WH3837>: and he put<WH7896> his own droves<WH5739> apart<WH7896>, and put them not unto Laban<WH3837>'s flock<WH6629>.

And it came to pass<WH7194>, whensoever the stronger of the flock<WH6629> did conceive<WH3179>, that Jacob<WH3290> laid<WH7760> the rods<WH4731> before the eyes<WH5869> of the flock<WH6629> in the gutters<WH7298>, that they might conceive<WH3179> among the rods<WH4731>;
but when the flock<WH6629> were feeble<WH5848>, he put them not in<WH7760>: so the feebler<WH5848> were Laban<WH3837>'s, and the stronger<WH7194> Jacob<WH3290>'s.
And the man<WH376> increased<WH6555> exceedingly<WH3966>, and had large<WH7227> flocks<WH6629>, and maid-servants<WH8198> and men-servants<WH5650>, and camels<WH1581> and asses<WH2543>.
